bibl.title: Talking Books. Readings in Hellenistic and Roman Books of Poetry.
bibl.note: See pp. 1-41, 18 figg.: Doing Things with Books [a version of this chapter was tried out at a conference on literary papyri at Austin, Texas; concentrates on the reading and writing of Greek books in the third century BC and of Latin books in the first century BC]; - 42-65: The Aetia: Callimachus' Poem of Knowledge [originally delivered to a seminar on the Aetia in the summer of 2003; pp. 64-65: Appendix. Catullus' Callimachean Book and the Lock of Berenice]; - 90-108: The New Posidippus and Latin Poetry.
bibl.seg: 364 Callimachus Carmina varia Graeca Posidippus Pellensis
HUTCHINSON G.O., Talking Books. Readings in Hellenistic and Roman Books of Poetry.
Oxford, Oxford University Press, 2008, 8°, xiv-332 pp., 18 figg. ISBN 978-0-19-927941-8. £69.

See pp. 1-41, 18 figg.: Doing Things with Books [a version of this chapter was tried out at a conference on literary papyri at Austin, Texas; concentrates on the reading and writing of Greek books in the third century BC and of Latin books in the first century BC]; - 42-65: The Aetia: Callimachus' Poem of Knowledge [originally delivered to a seminar on the Aetia in the summer of 2003; pp. 64-65: Appendix. Catullus' Callimachean Book and the Lock of Berenice]; - 90-108: The New Posidippus and Latin Poetry.

C.R. par Alain Billault, REG 122 (2009) pp. 662-663. - Niklas Holzberg, Gnomon 81 (2009) pp. 559-561. - John B. van Sickle, CR N.S., 59 (2009) pp. 413-415. - Katharina Volk, JRS 99 (2009) pp. 259-261.
